The wiki defaults to the British convention for floor numbering: Ground floor, first floor, etc. This may be changed by clicking the moon icon at the top right of the site.
This quest has a quick guide found here.
It briefly summarises the steps needed to complete the quest.
Rune Mysteries (#51)
Released 1 December 2003 (Update)
Members No
Quest series Order of Wizards
Official difficulty Novice
Lead developer(s) James B

Rune Mysteries is a novice level Free-to-play quest, and a requirement for mining rune essence within the Rune Essence mine or using lamps and books on runecraft.

Note that multiple air talismans can be obtained by using the drop trick at Duke Horacio. Grabbing 50-200 talismans can be useful for early runecraft training methods such as crafting air tiaras or mist runes. For details, see this guide.

Contents

  • 1 Details
  • 2 Walkthrough
  • 3 Rewards
  • 4 Required for completing
  • 5 Transcript
  • 6 Changes

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Speak to Duke Horacio on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of Lumbridge Castle.
Official difficultyNovice
DescriptionRecent research at the Wizards' Tower has found a way to create Runes for the first time in centuries. Assist the head wizard Sedridor in his research and he too may teach you these secrets!
Official lengthShort
Requirements None
Items required None
Recommended
  • Fast travel to Varrock (Varrock teleport, Chronicle or (members only) Ring of Wealth to the Grand Exchange or Combat Bracelet to the Champions' Guild)
  • (Members only) Fast travel to the Wizards' Tower (Necklace of Passage, Amulet of Glory to Draynor Village or Fairy Rings to dis)
Enemies to defeat None
{"requirements":"","desc":"Recent research at the [[Wizards' Tower]] has found a way to create Runes for the first time in centuries. Assist the head wizard Sedridor in his research and he too may teach you these secrets!","difficulty":"Novice","kills":"None","name":"Rune Mysteries","start":"Speak to [[Duke Horacio]] on the <span class=\"floornumber\"><span class=\"floornumber-gb\">1<sup class=\"floornumber-ordinal-suffix\">st</sup> floor<sup class=\"floornumber-help noexcerpt\">[<span class=\"fact-text floor-convention\" title=\"British convention; floor 2 in the US\">UK</span>]</sup></span><span class=\"floornumber-us noexcerpt\">2<sup class=\"floornumber-ordinal-suffix\">nd</sup> floor<sup class=\"floornumber-help noexcerpt\">[<span class=\"fact-text floor-convention\" title=\"US convention; floor 1 in the UK\">US</span>]</sup></span></span> of [[Lumbridge Castle]].","length":"Short","items":"None"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Talk to Duke Horacio on the 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US] of Lumbridge Castle, and ask him if he has any quests to give out. He will explain that although he himself has no tasks for the player, he did find a strange talisman. Curious about its origin, he will give you an air talisman and ask you to bring it to the arch mage of the Wizards' Tower. Note that at this point, it is possible to use the drop trick to collect any amount of spare air talismans, either for banking some Runecraft experience on ironman accounts, or for making a small amount of money. See the money making guide for more info.

Go to the Wizards' Tower, which is south of Draynor Village. Once there, descend the ladder into the basement and converse with Archmage Sedridor. He will take your air talisman and give you a research package. He will then instruct you to deliver it to Aubury in Varrock.

Aubury is located south of Varrock's east bank, inside of his rune shop. Talk to Aubury twice, and he will give you some notes and instruct you to deliver them back to Wizard Sedridor.

Make your way back to the Wizards' Tower, and talk to Archmage Sedridor once more. He will give you back your air talisman and will explain to you the basics of Runecraft.

Quest complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 1 Quest point
  • The ability to mine rune essence
  • An air talisman
  • The ability to use lamps and books of knowledge from random events on Runecraft
  • Completing this quest awards the player with 5 Kudos which can be claimed by talking to Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum.

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

Completion of Rune Mysteries is required for the following:

  • Enter the Abyss
  • Lunar Diplomacy
  • One Small Favour
  • The Lost Tribe
  • What Lies Below

Transcript[edit | edit source]

This article on a quest has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations encountered throughout the quest.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
23 March 2022
(update)

Dialogue pertaining to the quest was rewritten to flow better and be consistent with established lore. The quest now focuses on rediscovering the essence mine rather than runecrafting as a whole.

16 January 2007
(update)

The quest was renamed from "Rune Mysteries Quest" to "Rune Mysteries".

'''Rune Mysteries''' is a novice level [[Free-to-play]] [[quest]], and a requirement for mining [[rune essence]] within the [[Rune Essence mine]] or using [[lamps]] and [[book of knowledge|books]] on [[runecraft]].

Note that multiple [[air talisman]]s can be obtained by using the [[drop trick]] at [[Duke Horacio]]. Grabbing 50-200 talismans can be useful for early runecraft training methods such as crafting [[air tiara]]s or [[mist rune]]s. For details, see [[Money making guide/Collecting air talismans|this guide]].

==Details==
{{Quest details
|description = Recent research at the [[Wizards' Tower]] has found a way to create Runes for the first time in centuries. Assist the head wizard Sedridor in his research and he too may teach you these secrets!
|start = Speak to [[Duke Horacio]] on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of [[Lumbridge Castle]].
|difficulty = Novice
|length = Short
|requirements = 
|items = None
|recommended = * Fast travel to [[Varrock]] ([[Varrock teleport]], [[Chronicle]] or ''([[members]] only)'' [[Ring of Wealth]] to the Grand Exchange or [[Combat Bracelet]] to the [[Champions' Guild]])
* ''(Members only)'' Fast travel to the [[Wizards' Tower]] ([[Necklace of Passage]], [[Amulet of Glory]] to Draynor Village or [[Fairy Rings]] to {{Fairycode|dis}})
}}

==Walkthrough==
Talk to [[Duke Horacio]] on the {{FloorNumber|uk=1}} of [[Lumbridge Castle]], and ask him if he has any quests to give out. He will explain that although he himself has no tasks for the player, he did find a strange talisman. Curious about its origin, he will give you an [[air talisman]] and ask you to bring it to the arch mage of the [[Wizards' Tower]]. Note that at this point, it is possible to use the [[drop trick]] to collect any amount of spare [[air talisman]]s, either for banking some [[Runecraft]] experience on [[ironman]] accounts, or for making a small amount of money. See [[Money making guide/Collecting air talismans|the money making guide]] for more info.

Go to the Wizards' Tower, which is south of [[Draynor Village]]. Once there, descend the ladder into the basement and converse with [[Archmage Sedridor]]. He will take your air talisman and give you a [[research package]]. He will then instruct you to deliver it to [[Aubury]] in [[Varrock]].

Aubury is located south of [[Varrock east bank|Varrock's east bank]], inside of [[Aubury's Rune Shop|his rune shop]]. Talk to Aubury '''twice''', and he will give you some [[Notes (Rune Mysteries)|notes]] and instruct you to deliver them back to Wizard Sedridor.

Make your way back to the [[Wizards' Tower]], and talk to [[Archmage Sedridor]] once more. He will give you back your air talisman and will explain to you the basics of [[Runecraft]].

'''Quest complete!'''

==Rewards==
{{Quest rewards
|name = Rune Mysteries
|image = [[File:Rune Mysteries reward scroll.png|centre]]
|qp = 1
|rewards =
*The ability to mine [[rune essence]]
*An [[air talisman]]
*The ability to use [[lamp]]s and [[Book of Knowledge|books of knowledge]] from [[random events]] on [[Runecraft]]
*Completing this quest awards the player with 5 [[Kudos]] which can be claimed by talking to [[Historian Minas]] in the [[Varrock Museum]].
}}

==Required for completing==
Completion of Rune Mysteries is required for the following:
*[[Enter the Abyss]]
*[[Lunar Diplomacy]]
*[[One Small Favour]]
*[[The Lost Tribe]]
*[[What Lies Below]]
